frameDefinitions: A Text is an entity that contains linguistic, symbolic information on a Topic, created by an Author at the Time_of_creation.
A Speaker addresses an Audience on a particular Topic.
A recordable sequence of events is associated with a given Topic.
A Self_mover responds to a (real or imagined) danger by moving away from it.
An Agent or Cause makes a Patient sharper or duller.
This scenario describes a series of Events, associated with a single Participant, i.e., the history of the Participant.
frameExamples: McNamara <t>addressed</t> congress on the state of affairs of the Department of Defense.
And that is where the <t>history</t> of art begins.
She had <t>fled</t> from DCS facilities several times before..
John is in the basement <t>sharpening</t> his axe.
We've been worried about our recent hire's <t><fex name='Events'>history</fex></t> of deceiving employers.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Text</fen> is the entity that contains linguistic information. This an incorporated role for each LU in this frame.
The region where the <fen>Text</fen> is sold, circulated, or otherwise popular.
The person or persons to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> delivers their text.
The person who orally delivers a text about a <fen>Topic</fen> to a passive <fen>Audience</fen>.
What the text that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces is about.
The <fen>Time</fen> describes when the speaking occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> describes the location where the speaking occurs.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject about which the history is given.
When the events concerning the <fen>Topic</fen> occured.
<fen>Self_mover</fen> is the living (or self-directed) being which moves under its own power.
<fen>Source</fen> is used for any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion.
<fen>Path</fen> is used for any description of a trajectory of motion involving a landmark which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen>.  This includes 'middle of path'' expressions.
<fen>Goal</fen> is used for any expression which tells where the <fen>Self_mover</fen> ends up as a result of the motion.
The direction that the <fen>Self_mover</fen> heads in during the motion.
The time when the motion occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which a defined motion takes place.  Any specified or implied  <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen> should designate a location contained with the <fen>Place</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Patient</fen> to become more or less sharp.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is the entity that is sharpened.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces the state of sharpness.  Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> sharpens <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> sharpens the <fen>Patient</fen>.

The <fen>Participant</fen> is either an active participant in all of the <fen>Events</fen> (e.g., Agent or Patient), or is more peripherally associated with the <fen>Events</fen> (e.g., Location or Topic).
The <fen>Events</fen> which the <fen>Participant</fen> is a part of. This role is used to mark the frame-evoking element.
When the <fen>Events</fen> concerning the <fen>Participant</fen> occured.
listRoleExamples: He lectured <fex>to the officers of the Scots Guard</fex>  in  1929.
<fex>You</fex> have to sermonize about the good times
He was the Director: he could lecture <fex>on whomever he liked</fex>.
The role of the Byzantine Empire in <fex>European</fex> history is not understood by all.
<fex>The smith</fex> sharpened many knives in the days before the war.
Several cuts into the log had dulled <fex>the blade</fex>.
<fex>The relentless impacts against the wood</fex> gradually blunted the edge of this axe.
We've been worried about <fex>our recent hire's</fex> history of deceiving employers.
We will focus on events in her recent <fex>history</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the early years of the twentieth century

the Fu Foundation School of Engineering
